enum.name: MAV_COMPONENT
enum.description: Component ids (values) for the different types and instances of onboard hardware/software that might make up a MAVLink system (autopilot, cameras, servos, GPS systems, avoidance systems etc.). Components must use the appropriate ID in their source address when sending messages. Components can also use IDs to determine if they are the intended recipient of an incoming message. The MAV_COMP_ID_ALL value is used to indicate messages that must be processed by all components. When creating new entries, components that can have multiple instances (e.g. cameras, servos etc.) should be allocated sequential values. An appropriate number of values should be left free after these components to allow the number of instances to be expanded.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ALL
entry.description: Target id (target_component) used to broadcast messages to all components of the receiving system. Components should attempt to process messages with this component ID and forward to components on any other interfaces. Note: This is not a valid *source* component id for a message.

enum.name: MPPT_BATTERY_STATUS
enum.description: Represents the status of the battery. Derived from input register 3200.

entry.name: MPPT_STATUS_NORMAL
entry.description: All monitored parameters are normal. For battery (ID=3200): Voltage Normal (D3-D0=00H), Temp Normal (D7-D4=00H), Internal Resistance Normal (D8=0), Rated Voltage ID Normal (D15=0).

entry.name: MPPT_STATUS_VOLTAGE_LOW_VOLT_DISCONNECT
entry.description: Battery low voltage disconnect activated (e.g., ID=3200, D3-D0 = 03H).

entry.name: MPPT_STATUS_VOLTAGE_FAULT
entry.description: A general battery voltage fault detected (e.g., ID=3200, D3-D0 = 04H).

entry.name: MPPT_STATUS_INTERNAL_RESISTANCE_ABNORMAL
entry.description: Battery internal resistance is abnormal (e.g., ID=3200, D8 = 1).

entry.name: MPPT_STATUS_RATED_VOLTAGE_ID_WRONG
entry.description: Wrong identification for rated voltage (e.g., ID=3200, D15 = 1).

entry.name: MPPT_STATUS_UNKNOWN
entry.description: The status is unknown or not yet determined.

enum.name: MPPT_CHARGING_EQUIPMENT_STATUS
enum.description: Represents the primary status of the charging equipment. Derived by interpreting bits in input register 3201. The reported status may depend on the priority logic implemented in the monitoring software if multiple conditions are present.

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_STATUS_RUNNING_STANDBY
entry.description: Equipment is running mode, else standby (register 3201: D0=1 = running). Typically implies no active charging and no faults.

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_STATUS_FLOAT
entry.description: Equipment is in float charging mode (register 3201: D0=1, D1=0 (No Fault), D3-D2=01H (Float), and D15-D14=00H (Input Volt Normal)).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_STATUS_BOOST
entry.description: Equipment is in boost charging mode (register 3201: D0=1, D1=0 (No Fault), D3-D2=02H (Boost), and D15-D14=00H (Input Volt Normal)).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_STATUS_EQUALIZATION
entry.description: Equipment is in equalization charging mode (register 3201: D0=1, D1=0 (No Fault), D3-D2=03H (Equalization), and D15-D14=00H (Input Volt Normal)).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_INPUT_VOLTAGE_NONE
entry.description: No power connected to input (register 3201: D15-D14=01H). Equipment may be off or in a pre-start state.

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_INPUT_VOLTAGE_HIGH
entry.description: Input voltage is too high (register 3201: D15-D14=02H). This may lead to a fault condition (D1=1).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_INPUT_VOLTAGE_ERROR
entry.description: General input voltage error detected (register 3201: D15-D14=03H). This may lead to a fault condition (D1=1).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_FAULT_PV_SHORT
entry.description: PV input short circuit detected (register 3201: D4=1. Typically, D1=1 will also be set).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_FAULT_LOAD_SIDE
entry.description: Fault on the load side, such as load over current (D9=1), load short circuit (D8=1), or load MOSFET short (D7=1) (register 3201. Typically, D1=1 will also be set).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_FAULT_INPUT_OVERCURRENT
entry.description: Input over current detected (register 3201: D10=1. Typically, D1=1 will also be set).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_FAULT_MOSFET_SHORT
entry.description: Internal MOSFET short circuit detected (Charging MOSFET D13=1, Charging or Anti-reverse MOSFET D12=1, or Anti-reverse MOSFET D11=1) (register 3201. Typically, D1=1 will also be set).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_FAULT_SYSTEM
entry.description: A general system fault is active (register 3201: D1=1), not covered by other more specific fault entries in this enum.

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_STATUS_NO_CHARGING
entry.description: Equipment is running but not actively charging (register 3201: D0=1, D1=0 (No Fault), D3-D2=00H (No Charging), and D15-D14=00H (Input Volt Normal)).

entry.name: MPPT_CHARGING_STATUS_UNKNOWN
entry.description: The charging equipment status is unknown or not yet determined.

enum.name: BMS_CHARGE_DISCHARGE_STATUS_FLAGS
enum.description:
Flags to describe the charge/discharge status of a battery system, designed to be packed into a single byte. The status is composed of three parts: 1. Operational State (2 bits, bits 0-1): Indicates if the system is stationary, charging, or discharging. - 0 (00b): Stationary - 1 (01b): Charging - 2 (10b): Discharging - 3 (11b): Reserved for future use. 2. Charge MOSFET State (1 bit, bit 2): Indicates if the charge MOSFET is ON (1) or OFF (0). 3. Discharge MOSFET State (1 bit, bit 3): Indicates if the discharge MOSFET is ON (1) or OFF (0).
The enum entries provide values that can be ORed together to form the complete status byte. For example, to represent 'Charging' with 'Charge MOS ON' and 'Discharge MOS OFF': (CHARGE_DISCHARGE_STATE_CHARGING | CHARGE_DISCHARGE_CHARGE_MOS_ON) This would result in a value of (1 | 4) = 5.
To decode: - state = value and 0x03; - charge_mos_on = (value and CHARGE_DISCHARGE_CHARGE_MOS_ON) != 0 - discharge_mos_on = (value and CHARGE_DISCHARGE_DISCHARGE_MOS_ON) != 0

entry.name: CHARGE_DISCHARGE_STATE_STATIONARY
entry.description: Operational state is Stationary (neither charging nor discharging). This value (00b) occupies bits 0-1.

entry.name: CHARGE_DISCHARGE_STATE_CHARGING
entry.description: Operational state is Charging. This value (01b) occupies bits 0-1.

entry.name: CHARGE_DISCHARGE_STATE_DISCHARGING
entry.description: Operational state is Discharging. This value (10b) occupies bits 0-1.

entry.name: CHARGE_DISCHARGE_CHARGE_MOS_ON
entry.description: Charge MOSFET is ON. This flag occupies bit 2. If this flag is not set, Charge MOS is OFF.

entry.name: CHARGE_DISCHARGE_DISCHARGE_MOS_ON
entry.description: Discharge MOSFET is ON. This flag occupies bit 3. If this flag is not set, Discharge MOS is OFF.

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE0_VOLTAGE_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 0 of the Daly BMS failure status: Voltage-related failures.

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE1_TEMP_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 1 of the Daly BMS failure status: Temperature-related failures.

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE2_CURRENT_SOC_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 2 of the Daly BMS failure status: Current and SOC related failures.

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE3_DIFFERENTIAL_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 3 of the Daly BMS failure status: Differential voltage/temperature failures. Bits 4-7 are reserved.

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE4_MOSFET_SENSOR_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 4 of the Daly BMS failure status: MOSFET and related sensor failures.

entry.name: DALY_FAILURE_DISCHG_MOS_OPEN_CIRCUIT_ERR
entry.description: Discharge MOS open circuit error (Corrected from 'Discrg' in PDF).

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE5_SYSTEM_COMPONENT_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 5 of the Daly BMS failure status: System/Component failures.

enum.name: DALY_FAILURE_BYTE6_OTHER_FAULTS_FLAGS
enum.description: Flags for Byte 6 of the Daly BMS failure status: Other faults. Bits 4-7 are reserved.

enum.name: EZKONTROL_STATUS_GEAR
enum.description: ESC Gear status derived from bits 2-0 from message II, byte 3

enum.name: EZKONTROL_STATUS_OPERATION_MODE
enum.description: ESC operation mode derived from bits 6-4 from message II, byte 3

enum.name: EZKONTROL_STATUS_BYTE3_FLAGS
enum.description: Status flags from Byte 3 of EZkontrol MCU Message II (Brake, DC Contactor).

enum.name: EZKONTROL_ERROR_BYTE4_FLAGS
enum.description: Error flags from Byte 4 of EZkontrol MCU Message II.

enum.name: EZKONTROL_ERROR_BYTE5_FLAGS
enum.description: Error flags from Byte 5 of EZkontrol MCU Message II.

entry.name: EZKONTROL_ERROR_DC_CONTACTOR_FAULT
entry.description: Error: DC Contactor fault (distinct from status).

enum.name: EZKONTROL_ERROR_BYTE6_FLAGS
enum.description: Error flags from Byte 6 of EZkontrol MCU Message II.

enum.name: MAV_PARAM_TYPE
enum.description: Specifies the datatype of a MAVLink parameter.

enum.name: MAV_SEVERITY
enum.description: Indicates the severity level, generally used for status messages to indicate their relative urgency. Based on RFC-5424 using expanded definitions at: http://www.kiwisyslog.com/kb/info:-syslog-message-levels/.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is unusable. This is a "panic" condition.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ALERT
entry.description: Action should be taken immediately. Indicates error in non-critical systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_CRITICAL
entry.description: Action must be taken immediately. Indicates failure in a primary system.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ERROR
entry.description: Indicates an error in secondary/redundant systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_WARNING
entry.description: Indicates about a possible future error if this is not resolved within a given timeframe. Example would be a low battery warning.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_NOTICE
entry.description: An unusual event has occurred, though not an error condition. This should be investigated for the root cause.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_INFO
entry.description: Normal operational messages. Useful for logging. No action is required for these messages.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_DEBUG
entry.description: Useful non-operational messages that can assist in debugging. These should not occur during normal operation.

message.name: TEMPERATURES
message.description: Temperature data for motor and MPPT.
message.field: MPPT temperature on its left side.
MPPT temperature on its left side.

message.name: GPS
message.field: Direction of the bow (source not from GPS, but from IMU)
Horizontal dilution of precision. Represents quality of GPS constellation. Values close to 1 are best. Above 5 is poor

message.name: BMS_STATUS
message.description: Daly BMS battery failure status (corresponds to original message 0x98). Contains multiple bytes of failure flags and a final fault code. Also includes temperatures and status bitfield of the battery management system (FET states, stationary, charging or discharging)
message.field: Charge/Discharge FET status and current charging status
Failure flags: Current and SOC related (Byte 2).
Failure flags: MOSFET and sensor related (Byte 4).
Raw fault code (Byte 7 from original message).

message.name: EZKONTROL_MCU_METER_DATA_I
message.description: Electrical data from EZkontrol ESC based on CAN Message I, including accelerator opening for higher frequency publishing. Phase current is excluded because it updates too rapidly for low bandwidth links
message.field: 0 for left motor, 1 for right motor

message.name: EZKONTROL_MCU_METER_DATA_II
message.description: Status data from EZkontrol ESC based on CAN Message II, excluding accelerator opening. Temperatures have an offset of -40 degrees Celsius.
message.field: Controller temperature. Actual value = MAVLink value - 40. Unit: degC
Motor temperature. Actual value = MAVLink value - 40. Unit: degC
Gear, brake, operation mode and DC contactor.
Life signal counter derived from bits 7-4 from byte 7, msg II.
0 for left motor, 1 for right motor

message.name: PUMPS
message.field: Bitmask of pump states. Bit 0: Pump Left, Bit 1: Pump Right

message.name: PARAM_REQUEST_READ
message.description: Request to read the onboard parameter with the param_id string id. Onboard parameters are stored as key[const char*] -> value[float]. This allows to send a parameter to any other component (such as the GCS) without the need of previous knowledge of possible parameter names. Thus the same GCS can store different parameters for different autopilots. See also https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html for a full documentation of QGroundControl and IMU code.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Parameter index. Send -1 to use the param ID field as identifier (else the param id will be ignored)

message.name: PARAM_VALUE
message.description: Emit the value of a onboard parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received parameters and allows him to re-request missing parameters after a loss or timeout. The parameter microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

message.name: PARAM_SET
message.description: Set a parameter value (write new value to permanent storage). The receiving component should acknowledge the new parameter value by broadcasting a PARAM_VALUE message (broadcasting ensures that multiple GCS all have an up-to-date list of all parameters). If the sending GCS did not receive a PARAM_VALUE within its timeout time, it should re-send the PARAM_SET message. The parameter microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

message.name: RADIO_STATUS
message.description: Status generated by radio and injected into MAVLink stream.
message.field: Radio instance, 0 for primary radio, 1 for secondary radio.
Local (message sender) received signal strength indication in device-dependent units/scale. Values: [0-254], UINT8_MAX: invalid/unknown.
Count of radio packet receive errors (since boot).

message.name: NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT
message.description: Send a key-value pair as float. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

message.name: NAMED_VALUE_INT
message.description: Send a key-value pair as integer. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

message.name: STATUSTEXT
message.description: Status text message. These messages are printed in yellow in the COMM console of QGroundControl. WARNING: They consume quite some bandwidth, so use only for important status and error messages. If implemented wisely, these messages are buffered on the MCU and sent only at a limited rate (e.g. 10 Hz).
message.field: Severity of status. Relies on the definitions within RFC-5424.
Status text message, without null termination character

Unique (opaque) identifier for this statustext message. May be used to reassemble a logical long-statustext message from a sequence of chunks. A value of zero indicates this is the only chunk in the sequence and the message can be emitted immediately.
This chunk's sequence number; indexing is from zero. Any null character in the text field is taken to mean this was the last chunk.

message.name: DEBUG
message.description: Send a debug value. The index is used to discriminate between values. These values show up in the plot of QGroundControl as DEBUG N.
